description: A Paris-based neurosurgeon confirmed that the North Korean leader suffered a stroke but said Mr. Kim did not undergo any surgery following related to the stroke.
title: Doctor Confirms Kim Jong-il Stroke
title_page: Doctor Confirms Kim Jong-il Stroke - The New York Times
maintext:
PARIS  The North Korean leader Kim Jong-il had a stroke in August but appears to be better, according to a French doctor who has treated him.
The doctor, François-Xavier Roux, told Le Figaro, the French daily: “Kim Jong-il suffered a stroke but did not undergo an operation. He is now better.”
Dr. Roux, a Paris-based neurosurgeon, added: “The photos that have just been published seem recent and authentic to me. I have the impression that he is in charge in North Korea. I can’t say more because of medical confidentiality and state secrecy.”
United States and South Korean officials have said that Mr. Kim, 66, suffered a stroke in August, raising questions about a possible succession and about who was making decisions on North Korea’s nuclear weapons program.
